abstract: Given the disclosure and discipline imposed by the Federal Reserve’s stress tests of big banks a year ago, regulators should consider making such stress test an annual event, Breakingviews says.
snippet: Given the disclosure and discipline imposed by the Federal Reserve’s stress tests of big banks a year ago, regulators should consider making such stress test an annual event, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: Improving bank regulation may call for a little more stress, Breakingviews says. The disclosure and discipline imposed by the Federal Reserve’s stress tests of big banks a year ago drew a line under the crisis. The tests separated sheep from goats and led to tens of billions of dollars of new capital being raised. It’s a shame that stress tests aren’t becoming an annual event, the publication says.

headline.main: Making a Case for Annual Stress Tests

abstract: A two-minute clip by a Filipino software engineer won a climate change video contest sponsored by the Asian Development Bank.
snippet: A two-minute clip by a Filipino software engineer won a climate change video contest sponsored by the Asian Development Bank.
lead_paragraph: How to fight climate change? Well, you could start by just saving some electricity. Or saying no to plastic bags. Or turning off the tap while you brush your teeth.

headline.main: ‘How to Save the World’ Wins Web Video Contest

abstract: Wall Street traders were cautious Tuesday amid worries that the European Union’s plan to help Greece might unwind, but signs that the Federal Reserve would keep interest rates low helped give stocks some support.
snippet: Wall Street traders were cautious Tuesday amid worries that the European Union’s plan to help Greece might unwind, but signs that the Federal Reserve would keep interest rates low helped give stocks some support.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street traders were cautious on Tuesday amid worries that the European Union’s plan to help Greece might unwind. But signs that the Federal Reserve would keep interest rates low helped give stocks some support, The New York Times’s Javier C. Hernandez reported.

headline.main: Wall Street Turns Mixed at the End of Day

abstract: HCA, the big hospital operator whose $33 billion takeover in 2006 heralded a slew of giant leveraged buyouts, is planning an initial public offering that may raise more than $3 billion, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Wednesday.
snippet: HCA, the big hospital operator whose $33 billion takeover in 2006 heralded a slew of giant leveraged buyouts, is planning an initial public offering that may raise more than $3 billion, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: HCA, the big hospital operator whose $33 billion takeover in 2006 heralded a slew of giant leveraged buyouts, is planning an initial public offering that may raise more than $3 billion, people briefed on the matter told DealBook on Wednesday.

headline.main: HCA Said to Plan I.P.O. for This Year

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
